headline: Cauliflower Pizza Crust
description: Delicious cauliflower pizza crust. You'll never guess this grain-free crust is made with cauliflower instead of flour. Serve with favorite toppings.

video.description: This low carb, low calorie and gluten free cauliflower crust pizza can take on any of your favorite toppings!
video.name: Cauliflower Pizza Crust

name: Cauliflower Pizza Crust
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place cauliflower pieces through the feeding tube of the food processor using the grating blade; pulse until all the cauliflower is shredded.

Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer. Bring water to a boil. Add cauliflower, cover, and steam until tender, about 15 minutes. Transfer cauliflower to a large bowl and refrigerate, stirring occasionally, until cooled, about 15 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
Stir Italian cheese blend, parsley, egg, garlic, salt, and pepper into cauliflower until evenly incorporated. Pour mixture onto the prepared baking sheet; press and shape into a pizza crust.
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Trash recipe. So while everything tastes fine the written instructions leave out many crucial steps. A. Cool Cauliflower B. Squeeze all the water out of the cooled Cauliflower C. After fully squeezed, place on tray AND BAKE FIRST before putting ingredients on, otherwise it won't hold up. While these instructions are in the video, many people wouldn't watch it so these instructions should be in the written ones so that people who print it off have them. Tastes fine, bad instructions; and cooking the food is 90% of the job.

I thought it turned out great. I used frozen cauliflower and instead of parsley, I used 1TBS of Italian Seasoning. I usually make exactly as recipe states, however, I thought Italian Seasoning would add a little more flavor. I will make again.
Tastes great but a little runny
Drain cauliflower well! Parmesan works well because it is drier. And after one side bakes, flip and bake about 8 minutes more.
Loved the flavor but was a little disappointed in the texture. Although I squeezed a lot of moisture out of the zucchini, the crust was still kind of soggy.
The best pizza crust we have ever had
This was super mushy. I felt it needed to cook for an hour to firm up.
easy to make I loved it
I made this last night. I doubled the recipe. It was good

I used a frozen bag of riced cauliflower, for convenience, microwaved 4 minutes and let cool, it never got very hot so it was quick. Drained well. Added all the other ingredients. Spread and patted firmly on parchment paper. Baked 450 degrees for 20 minutes. I flipped onto a pizza pan with holes, added well drained canned chicken, thinly sliced sweet onion, topped with mozzarella and baked to a delicious golden brown cheesy deliciousness. No sauce needed. It was better than regular pizza. I reheated in a skillet to maintain the crispiness of the crust, it was almost better the second day. Low low carb.
This turned quite well, I will definitely make it again

Of course I made my own adjustments and it came out great. I also read a bunch of the reviews and adjusted according to those as well! I added about 3tsp of corn starch to help absorb the extra water. I microwaved the cauliflower, the first bake I set the timer on 10min. After I loaded it up I baked it on the second lowest rack to help the crust become crispy. I topped mine with A few pepperonis, shredded baked chicken breast, diced onions/peppers, and Italian cheese. Next time I make it, I’m going to bake it raw.
Too much work and preferred the store bought cauliflower pizza

I have tried, unsuccessfully, to make other keto pizza crusts before, but this is awesome! It was super easy to make. I used the frozen riced cauliflower and it worked perfect. I also added a little coconut flour as suggested by another comment. Next time I will definitely make more and freeze them!
Mine turned out mushy. I'll try again but next time I'm not going to steam the cauliflower, I'll just use it raw. See if that helps.

This recipe puzzles me. .as do the loving huzzahs in response. If you follow the directions as they stand, there is no way that you cannot have a crumbly mess. ..given normal , without juicer, scenarios. There is no binding agent here. What holds the dough together? Cauliflower and cheese? This needs other agents added. Some have added almond flour, cocoanut flour, rice flour , tapioca ..there is no way this completely holds togethe without a binding agent. Great thought, tho.
Fabulous! Loved every bite!

very good! I make pizza rollups with this 
also eat as a snack plain!!
I’ve made and loved this, but with cauliflower being on sale I am wondering if I can mass produce and freeze portions after I mix it all together and use after freezing?

This turned put great! I actually took the advice of someone else on here. They pushed the cauliflower through a juicer to chop it up and then just par bake the crust and then topped it and bake it again it came out great! This pizza is topped with Italian sausage peppers onions garlic chicken of the woods mushrooms, pickled ramps, and cilantro cream fresh.

I cooked for twice as long as recipe called for and this stuff was still sticky. My once adored vegetable of cauliflower has been burned into my brain. I have the feeling that I have made this recipe 1 more time than the person who wrote it. Once will be enough.
This is the best!! I thoroughly enjoyed this crust - I topped it with homemade sauce, fresh tomato, fresh mozzarella, Italian cheese blend, salami and bacon with fresh basil.

My husband said this was his favorite pizza crust! To save time, I used packaged riced cauliflower and steamed it in the microwave. I then used a mesh colander to squeeze out as much liquid as possible. Then followed the directions shown. I baked it as directed first, then added the toppings and baked it again until the cheese was melted.
Falls apart.

Good alternative to regular pizza crust, but the flavor will take time to get used to. For people that are looking for low carb alternatives an almond or coconut flower crust has better flavor and texture. I also found them easier to make.

I hate cauliflower.... but this was yummy! 
I was short on time, so puréed the raw cauliflower and made the crust... baked at 425 for 15 mins. Then put toppings on & back in 450 degree oven for 7 mins. 

I added fresh basil to to cauliflower in my food processor!
Will def make again. Loved it!

My first try was a success, probably cooked it longer..I wanted it a little crispier and more brown around the edges.
I put a whole head of cauliflower in the instant pot for 5min and quick pressure release. I put it in the freezer for a few minutes to get cool. I mashed it up and put it in a cloth, as recommended, to squeeze the water out. Mixed it with mozzarella, cheddar( about a 1/2 cup each) dried parsley, an egg and tsp garlic. I didn’t have parchment paper but I see why that would be helpful. I sprayed my pan with Pam. I put mine on the pan pretty thin. I flipped it about half way and part of it stuck to the pan. I let it cool, then topped it with pizza sauce, mozzarella, green peppers and olives. It turned out AMAZING! My husband is not a fan of cauliflower and he loved it. We are doing a low carb diet and this hits the spot for a pizza craving.

I used this to make a Keto Mexican Pizza but with a microwave shortcut and some chopped green chiles for more of a tex mex flavor. So many bad keto bread recipes out there but this one is now in our regular rotation.

I made it for the third time, and used just one egg, and parmesian and mozzerella, in the mix. And i also used cheesecloth to drain the water from it. Im still not satisfied with the amount of water i can't get out of it that way either but it still turned out real good. I also don't use the parchment paper and it works out.

GREAT base recipe, though I admit I modded it. Doubled it and added 1/4 cup almond flour, as well as fresh basil and some cooked ground turkey crumbles. We actually dehydrated the cauliflower for 8 hours first (prepped in the morning and let it sit) to pull some of the moisture out of it. It may seem like an excessive step but it did a great job of helping us get the “dough” into a more dough-like density. The bake was spot-on: 450° @ 15 minutes. Dough was shaped into a flat disc with a pita-like thickness (1/4” or so).

Thanks!

I made this recipe for the first time because me and my husband are trying to do the keto diet and we also have to feed 3 kids. I read the comments and decided to juice the raw cauliflower as one person suggested. I also flipped the crusts over half way through and they came out perfectly. They held together nicely and it definitely would curb my pizza cravings.
I went the extra mile, as always, and added some diced black olives, feta cheese, and sliced green olives. I'm sure the original recipe would have been fine, but I was going for presentation.
Came out great. One cauliflower yielded an 8in pizza for me.

We really liked this crust. I was afraid that my husband would not even try it but he did and said it was good.
Next time I will roll out the dough between two pieces of parchment paper to the size of my cookie sheet without the edge. I think it will not take so long to cook and make it crispy.
Will definitely be making this recipe again
Delicious ... I just did not get enough moisture out of the riced cauliflower... will definitely use in the future

Loved it! I left out the fresh parsley because when I went to get some my plant had disappeared. Toppings were olive oil, shredded mozzarella cheese, fresh basil and Bella mushrooms. Added another spray of olive oil and freshly grated Parmesan and shredded mozzarella on top.

Great! Simple, fast, & great taste. Like it better with ham than
pepperoni. The pepperoni is a bit too greasy for me.
I followed recipe to the letter. Crust very good however not crispy like I like pizza crust. My suggestion is to squeeze excess water from cooled riced cauliflower.

I will make it again and double the amount. It was more like a large personal size pizza. My husband and I split it, but he needed a little more. He is gluten free and liked it better than most gluten free recipes in general.

I made it from this recipe. It was ok, but for those who do not like cauliflower that much this recipe is probably not for you. It starts out with a yummy cheesy flavor and then finishes with that cauliflower taste.

Tastes really good and the edges did definitely crisp up a bit. I took off one star because it was pretty crumbly towards the middle and that made it hard to eat even with a fork. I think it's all about the moisture level, possibly including the amount of sauce. Overall I liked it and will definitely be making it again .

Following hints in the reviews, I sauteed the chopped cauliflower until it was dry and starting to brown instead of steaming it. I baked the crust on a pizza stone at 425 for 20 minutes. Then I added toppings and baked for 7 minutes. It wasn't mushy. The flavor was OK. My husband loved it. I still prefer a good, old-fashioned dough crust myself, but this wasn't bad.
I'm allergic to cows milk so I used grated pecorino romano (sheeps milk) in the crust and melted some shredded romano on the top. IT WAS AMAZING!

Awesome. 

I used two eggs and as suggested by another reviewer I baked the califlower for 15 min. As it cooled I blotted three times with paper towels. This made the mixture more solid.
Perfect consistency.

I will try this same receipe for bread.
Excellent crust! You can barely tell it is cauliflower

I used cauliflower pearls. Cooked in Microwave for 15 minutes with no added water. Let it cool and then mixed the other ingredients. It worked perfectly with no need to drain or dry in towels. Only recommendation I would suggest not using tomatoes and keeping sauce to minimum as it made the crust soggy. But very yummy with mozzarella and fresh basil!!
I made it for Super Bowl,it was fantastic

I just bake it as is. Don’t need to worry about moisture. Add a bit more cheese and 2 more eggs and bake for 25 minutes, then add your toppings and bake for 20 min at 350 and then broil for 10. So good.

Just made it for the first time. Baked crust twice as long as instructed it would not crisp. Finished pizza was good, but crust soggy. Now I see video shows squeezing water from cauliflower. I wish that step was in the printed recipe. I will see if it turns out better when I make it again.
I did add a few spices to the cauliflower. It was delicious!!! I will definitely make it again!!

I went to the farmer's market last week and needed to do something with the cauliflower before it went bad. I've been wanting to try pizza for a while and I stumbled upon your recipe and I loved it. 

I made a few changes: I microwaved my cauliflower about 8 min, cooled it, squeezed out as much liquid as I could. I like cheddar cheese so I used a sharp cheddar blend and baked the crust about 15 min. I made my own bbq sauce had a layer of parmesan cheese added some leftover chicken & onions to one half and ham on the other and baked another 15 min at 375°.

I am completely satisfied, it turned out great and will definitely make again.
I did not get enough moisture out of the cauliflower so it turned out mushy. The flavor was good but the crust was not crunchy!

The only change I made was to cook the cauliflower on medium in a skillet for about 10 minutes to dry it out, no butter or oil. It was very good but I used some cheddar cheese, maybe too much cheese since the pizza was greasy. Will definitely do it again.

I followed a few reviewer’s recommendations and steamed until just tender. Then I pulsed in my blender because I don’t have a food processor. Then I put on a clean kitchen towel and used my potatoe masher and mashed the water out of it. I spent extra time on this step and actually used two towels. Instead of fresh garlic in the crust, I used garlic powder and Italian spices. I took another piece of advice and after I pre-cooked the crust (20 minutes), I flipped it before topping it. Then after topping, I cooked another 20 minutes. It was wonderful! I would absolutely make it again trying different spices and cheeses in the crust.
I added garlic powder and friend oregano to the crust. Just starting a ketogenic lifestyle and pizza is the one thing I miss so this addressed my bread cravings.
I added sliced mushrooms to mine. It took some time but was delicious.

This definitely tastes like cauliflower! I used a whole head of cauliflower, not half. I did not have enough dough for a large pizza so I added almond flour plus the crust was a little wet. I cooked for 7 minutes then put toppings on and cooked until cheese was bubbly. I will not make this again.
This was gross. It made a cauliflower mash. Horrible texture. Need to figure out how to get a lot more moisture out. If you follow the recipe it’s inedible.

I tried to make this recipe, but I thought it came out horribly. My cauliflower fell apart and it was just gross threw it away. I tried it again with one added step. Ring out the cauliflower and boy did that step change the entire recipe. I would give it 4 stars had it not been for that missed information.

This is unbelievably delicious! I didn't have Italian cheese blend so I used shredded medium cheddar and added Italian spice blend. I topped the crust with onion, colored peppers, cheese and leftover chicken breast. Put the pan back in the cooling oven and added halved grape tomatoes and black olives prior to serving. And of course some grated fresh basil. :-)
My husband declared "this is the BEST pizza crust that I have ever had"
Very yummy and easy! I used frozen riced cauliflower which cut prep time. I could come to prefer this over traditional pizza crust!
I made it just as instructed. I will make it again. I think this is one of theose receipes that need practice to perfect :)
Loved the recipe! Will take one viewers suggestion and add coconut flower and pep several for future need.

I followed the recipe but doubled it. I just realized that I only put in one large egg and it still worked. I used a juicer as another reviewer suggested and used the pulp from the juicer and instead of steaming the cauliflower, I put it in a pan on top of the stove as Chef John suggested in his Cauliflower pizza recipe. This is a very good crust and held up to a lot of pizza toppings. I will definitely make this again and maybe next time I will try to brush the crust with olive oil before baking.
I also added a little bit of flour to soak up the extra moisture. Best cauliflower crust I have had yet!

This was wonderful. I am a bad type 2 diabetic so anything that helps n tastes good my sisyer will try this pizza is so good we tricked my other sister n her son who hates cauliflower into trying it they both loved it.
Delicious, it was easy and really delicious.
Amazing pizza crust.

I made this pizza crust. It tasted good. Found out that I much prefer regular crust for my pizza. This recipe was easy to make. Encountered a problem in that when all ingredients were added and mixed, there was a moderate amount of fluid in the bowl. Had to use a slotted spoon to fish out the cauliflower. Guess squeezing the cauliflower before mixing it all together would have gotten the excess fluid out. Might be helpful is that step is added to the recipe. Thank you.

I LOVE this cauliflower crust recipe; and the calories are so low!! I'm impressed!! I've made this twice and everyone loves it! I just use diced tomatoes as the sauce, but I love how the crust kind of fluffs and rises up more when you actually add a sauce substitute. Fluffy; but like real crust!
I bought frozen cauliflower from Trader Joes and grilled it a bit in a pan before combining with cheese. So delicious! Will be making many more times!
The best recipe I've tried yet. Make sure you squeeze as much water out as possible !
No matter how much I squeezed the water out of the veggies it still came out mushy, the taste was very good but it's not nice to eat it with the baking paper as they sort of combined during baking.

Added Italian seasoning to cauliflower before baking, followed Chef John's cooking for crust. flipped and added toppings. pesto spread on crust.
yellow and orange peppers, tomato rings. (no centers)jalapeno rings and mushrooms. cooked 15 minutes added mozzarella till melted.
I'm a bread, meat and potato man and I friggn loved it.
Excellent recipe - easy and delicious. Highly recommend.

I'm afraid I did make a laziness-induced change or two -- 
Used my grater attachment on the Kitchenaid and I microwaved the cauliflower with a couple of drops of water in a covered bowl. Didn't squeeze it out, so used a tablespoon or so of gluten-free flour to soak in the extra moisture. 

It was so very very good topped with pesto, mushrooms and zucchini -- and caramalized onions. No more cheese needed. It feels like I blew my diet but I didn't, really! Thank you for the idea; truly delicious.
My husband is Type 2 Diabetic. He totally LOVED this pizza crust. Not sure I'd change anything about this recipe. I loved it too! Definitely going to be a regular item for us now.

I followed the recipe, other than not steaming the cauliflower ahead of time. I presalted it and let it drain as I prepped other ingredients. The crust took about an hour to bake, not 15 minutes. Flavor and texture were not worth the effort. We threw out the leftovers, which rarely happens.

I followed the recipe, other than not steaming the cauliflower ahead of time. I presalted it and let it drain as I prepped other ingredients. The crust took about an hour to bake, not 15 minutes. Flavor and texture were not worth the effort. We threw out the leftovers, which rarely happens.

Very tasty! My only recommendation is to squeeze out extra water from the cauliflower before make it. The first one I made was very moist. Squeezing the excess water out made the second one much firmer. I actually use it as a bread substitute for sandwiches. Added some cheese on top and made bread sticks as well. 
Hubby says it's a keeper!
I’ve made cauliflower crust numerous times, but it’s been a while so I referenced this recipe. It crumbled and I was very disappointed in the texture. This recipe needs to be altered.

How awesome to not feel guilty eating pizza! It's a bit of a procedure to make, and man is there a lot of moisture to squeeze out. I think I didn't flatten mine enough in the centre because it was a bit soft and I kept adding another and another 5 minutes, but I didn't want the edges to get too dark. It was absolutely delicious and I'll make it again for sure.
The removal of extra water tip was exec Excellent!

I had to make a couple of changes because I didn't have some ingredients on hand. I didn't have fresh parsley so I substituted a couple of tablespoons of dried oregano. I had to use mozzarella cheese instead of the blend. I did use the fresh grated Parmesan. It turned out great! My husband, who does not like cauliflower, loved it. After the crust baked, I spread pizza sauce, cooked diced sausage, more mozzarella and Parmesan cheese on the crust and popped it back in the oven for 2 minutes until the cheese melted. It was delicious!

I had to make a couple of changes because I didn't have some ingredients on hand. I didn't have fresh parsley so I substituted a couple of tablespoons of dried oregano. I had to use mozzarella cheese instead of the blend. I did use the fresh grated Parmesan. It turned out great! My husband, who does not like cauliflower, loved it. After the crust baked, I spread pizza sauce, cooked diced sausage, more mozzarella and Parmesan cheese on the crust and popped it back in the oven for 2 minutes until the cheese melted. It was delicious!
Followed directions as shown! The best cauliflower pizza crust I have ever made or eaten. Thank you for sharing this recipe.
I just made this cauliflower pizza crust topped with pesto sauce and cheese vegies . this crust came out perfect love love this crust

I've been looking for the perfect keto pizza crust, so I tried this out. I'm a big fan of cauliflower, but there is no way that you'd 'never guess' that this is grain-free. I didn't like the comination of flavours, but of course, that is just personal preference. This recipe made quite a bit, so I made small rounds and ended up using them just to melt cheese on as a side dish. I think I'd rather just bake pizza toppings into a casserole and eat it that way. Next I'll be trying the keto crust made with pork rinds on my continuted quest......

This tasted great! It was definitely not the texture of crust but it tasted really good! I didn't use the parsley because I didn't have any and I used a 50/50 mixture of cheddar and parmessan for the cheese. I baked the shredded cauliflower on a cookie sheet with some avocado oil mixed in on 425 degrees for 15 minutes and then mixed it in with the rest of the ingredients and baked at 450 for 15 min. I then put on the toppings and baked at 450 until the cheese was melted, probably about 5 minutes.

Made this pizza crust tonight. I added a bit more cheese, frozen riced cauliflower, pesto (rather than tomato sauce), shredded organic chicken, diced onion, and fresh Parmesan cheese. It was fantastic! This crust WORKS!

I threw everything together in the food processor: I doubled the recipe and added an extra egg, 1/2 cup of cheese as well as 1/4 c coconut flour. I did not pre cook the cauliflower or drain it. After patting out the crusts (it made 4) I baked 20 mins at 400F and then baked another 15 at 450. They came out beautifully!

I found another recipe that that I liked much better. It added a little coconut flour to the cauliflower. The coconut flour absorbs the liquid so you don't have to squeeze the cauliflower. The crust also held together much better.
As made, will make again. Perfect pizza with a healthy blend. Trader Joe's is a great place to find ground cauliflower. Makes it so easy!!

Use equal amounts of shredded uncooked cauliflower, mozzarella cheese and eggs. Large pizza 2c cauliflower, 2c mozzarella, 2 eggs. No need to worry about water with uncooked cauliflower. Bake at 450 for 20 minutes, add toppings and bake another fifteen. 
I have made this many times and it always comes out great.
Followed the recipe to the T.."Taste GREAT however very soggy! I'll have to work on this, because it has promise.

This turned out so good! My family did not miss the traditional pizza dough, even my dad who does not like veggies was shocked after sampling my surprise pizza! He loved it. Will definitely keep this recipe around! Plus you can feel good about eating all the veggies!
Booo! Have made many cauliflower pizzas. This is the worst! Very mushy. I even broiled it to achieve baked affect. Didn't work.

Followed the recipe exactly as shown and came out great. Only problem i had was it got stuck to the bottom of my pan. I recommend spraying with cooking spray. Also, yes you need to squeeze the heck out of it. Didnt fall apart on me though.
